bất nghĩa<html><i>bất nghĩa</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Disloyal</b></font><ul><li><b>ăn ở bất nghĩa</b>: to behave in a disloyal way</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất ngờ<html><i>bất ngờ</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Sudden, unexpected, unforeseen</b></font><ul><li><b>cuộc gặp gỡ bất ngờ</b>: an unexpected encounter</li><li><b>đợi cho địch đến gần rồi bất ngờ nổ súng</b>: to wait until the enemy comes near then open up suddenly</li><li><b>bất ngờ trời đổ mưa</b>: all of a sudden, it poured</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất nhân<html><i>bất nhân</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Inhumane, unfeeling</b></font><ul><li><b>kẻ bất nhân</b>: an unfeeling person</li><li><b>cách ăn ở bất nhân</b>: an inhumane behaviour</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất nhã<html><i>bất nhã</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Rude, impolite</b></font><ul><li><b>thái độ bất nhã</b>: a rude attitude</li><li><b>nói như vậy là bất nhã</b>: such a way of speaking is impolite</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất như ý<html><i>bất như ý</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Not according to one's wish, not to one's liking</b></font></li></ul></html>
bất nhược<html><i>bất nhược</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> conj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Would rather</b></font><ul><li><b>chờ xe lâu, bất nhược đi bộ</b>: it takes a long time to wait for the bus, rather walk</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất nhất<html><i>bất nhất</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Inconsistent</b></font><ul><li><b>ý kiến bất nhất</b>: inconsistent ideas</li><li><b>thái độ bất nhất</b>: an inconsistent attitude</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất nhẫn<html><i>bất nhẫn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Compassionate, pitying</b></font><ul><li><b>cảm thấy bất nhẫn trước cảnh em bé mồ côi</b>: to feel compassionate for the plight of an orphan child</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Rather ruthless, rather heartless</b></font><ul><li><b>nói điều đó ra kể cũng bất nhẫn</b>: it was rather heartless to say that</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất nhật<html><i>bất nhật</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adv</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Any day in the future, any coming day impossible to fix</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất phương trình<html><i>bất phương trình</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (toán) Inequation</b></font></li></ul></html>
bất quá<html><i>bất quá</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> At most</b></font><ul><li><b>việc này bất quá năm ngày làm xong</b>: this job can be done in five days at most</li><li><b>ý kiến của anh ta bất quá chỉ được vài ba người tán thành</b>: his view is approved of by two or three people at most</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất thuận<html><i>bất thuận</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unfavourable</b></font><ul><li><b>Thời tiết bất thuận</b>: Unfavourable weather</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất thường<html><i>bất thường</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unusual, extraordinary, special</b></font><ul><li><b>hội nghị bất thường</b>: an extraordinary conference, an emergency conference</li><li><b>khoản chi bất thường</b>: an extraordinary expense</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Changeable</b></font><ul><li><b>thời tiết bất thường</b>: changeable weather</li><li><b>tính nết bất thường</b>: a changeable character</li><li><b>vui buồn bất thường</b>: a changeable mood</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất tiện<html><i>bất tiện</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Not convenient, inconvenient, out of place</b></font><ul><li><b>đường sá bất tiện</b>: communications are not convenient</li><li><b>ở xa, đi lại bất tiện</b>: when one lives so far, it is inconvenient to travel to and from</li><li><b>việc đó nói giữa chỗ đông người e bất tiện</b>: talking about in a crowd is, I'm afraid, out of place</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất trung<html><i>bất trung</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Disloyal, unfaithful</b></font></li></ul></html>
bất trắc<html><i>bất trắc</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unlucky</b></font><ul><li><b>việc bất trắc</b>: an unlucky event, a mishap</li><li><b>phòng khi bất trắc</b>: in prevention of mishaps</li><li><b>đề phòng mọi bất trắc</b>: to guard against all mishaps, to take precautions against all contingencies</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Knavish (nói về người)</b></font><ul><li><b>con người bất trắc</b>: a knavish person</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất trị<html><i>bất trị</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Incurable</b></font><ul><li><b>bệnh bất trị</b>: an incurable disease</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Unruly, refractory</b></font><ul><li><b>thằng bé bất trị</b>: an unruly little boy</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất tuyệt<html><i>bất tuyệt</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unending</b></font></li></ul></html>
bất tài<html><i>bất tài</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Incapable</b></font><ul><li><b>kẻ bất tài</b>: an incapable person</li></ul></li></ul></html>

bất tường<html><i>bất tường</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Ill-omened, ominous</b></font><ul><li><b> điềm bất tường</b>: an ominous sign</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất tất<html><i>bất tất</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unnecessary, needless</b></font><ul><li><b>vấn đề ấy bất tất phải bàn nhiều</b>: it is unnecessary to discuss much that issue, that issue needs not much discussion</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất tận<html><i>bất tận</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unending</b></font><ul><li><b>những dòng người bất tận</b>: unending flows of people</li><li><b>niềm vui bất tận</b>: unending joy</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất tỉnh<html><i>bất tỉnh</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unconscious, insensible</b></font><ul><li><b>bị thương nặng, nằm bất tỉnh</b>: seriously wounded, he lay unconscious</li><li><b>nghe tin đau xót, ngã lăn ra bất tỉnh</b>: on hearing the painful news, she fell down unconscious; on hearing the painful news, she fainted</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất tử<html><i>bất tử</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Immortal</b></font><ul><li><b>những người anh hùng đã trở thành bất tử</b>: heroes having become immortal</li><li><b>"Có những phút làm nên lịch sử, Có cái chết hoá thành bất tử"</b>: There are moments which make history, There are deaths which make people immortal</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Rash, reckless</b></font><ul><li><b>đồ bất tử</b>: a reckless fellow</li><li><b>ăn nói bất tử</b>: to behave rashly in speech</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>All of a sudden</b></font><ul><li><b>ngã lăn ra chết bất tử</b>: to fall dead all of a sudden</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất xâm phạm<html><i>bất xâm phạm</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (Hiệp ước bất xâm phạm) Treaty of non-aggression</b></font></li></ul></html>
bất ý<html><i>bất ý</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Heedless, careless, negligent</b></font></li></ul></html>
bất đắc chí<html><i>bất đắc chí</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Disappointed, frustrated, bitter</b></font><ul><li><b>nhà nho bất đắc chí</b>: a frustrated scholar</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất đắc dĩ<html><i>bất đắc dĩ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unavoidable, reluctant, grudging</b></font><ul><li><b>việc bất đắc dĩ</b>: an unavoidable thing</li><li><b>từ chối không được, bất đắc dĩ phải nhận</b>: as it was impossible to refuse, he grudgingly accepted</li><li><b>đó là điều vạn bất đắc dĩ</b>: that is unavoidable indeed</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất định<html><i>bất định</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Unstable, unequable</b></font><ul><li><b>tâm thần bất định</b>: an unequable mind</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất đồ<html><i>bất đồ</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Suddenly, all of a sudden, unexpectedly</b></font><ul><li><b>đang đi chơi, bất đồ trời đổ mưa</b>: as he was going for a walk, suddenly it started pouring</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất đồng<html><i>bất đồng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Uneven, not simultaneous</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Different, dissimilar</b></font><ul><li><b>ngôn ngữ bất đồng</b>: speaking different languages, not having a common language, not sharing the same language</li><li><b>ý kiến bất đồng</b>: different ideas</li><li><b>bất đồng về quan điểm</b>: to differ in opinion, to hold dissimilar views</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất động<html><i>bất động</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Motionless</b></font><ul><li><b>người ốm nằm bất động trên giừơng</b>: the sick person lay motionless in his bed, the sick person was bedridden</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Fixed</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bất động sản<html><i>bất động sản</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Real estate, real property, immovable property, immovables</b></font><ul><li><b>thuế bất động sản</b>: tax on immovables</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấu<html><i>bấu</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To hold fast to with one's fingers</b></font><ul><li><b>bấu vào kẽ đá để trèo lên</b>: to climb up by holding fast to the crevices with one's fingers</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To pinch</b></font><ul><li><b>bấu má ai</b>: to pinch somebody's cheeks</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To nip off</b></font><ul><li><b>bấu một miếng xôi</b>: to nip off a bite of sticky rice</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấu véo<html><i>bấu véo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To nip off little by little (in a brazen way)</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấu víu<html><i>bấu víu</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To hold fast to</b></font><ul><li><b>dốc núi cao lại không có chỗ bấu víu để trèo lên</b>: the mountain slope was steep and had nothing for them to hold fast to when climbing</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To lean on (when in distress)</b></font><ul><li><b>bơ vơ không biết bấu víu vào đâu</b>: alone in the world and without any support to lean on</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấy<html><i>bấy</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Tender, immature, green</b></font><ul><li><b>cua bấy</b>: a shedder</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Meltingly soft, pulpy</b></font><ul><li><b>quả chuối chín bấy</b>: a meltingly ripe banana</li><li><b>nát bấy</b>: crushed to pulp</li><li><b>bấy như tương</b>: pulpy like soya paste</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> So much</b></font><ul><li><b>bao nhiêu cay đắng, bấy niềm tin</b>: so much bitterness, so much faith</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Then</b></font><ul><li><b>từ bấy đến nay</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấy bá<html><i>bấy bá</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Meltingly soft</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấy chầy<html><i>bấy chầy</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> For long, since long, ever since</b></font></li></ul></html>
bấy chừ<html><i>bấy chừ</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Then</b></font></li></ul></html>
bấy giờ<html><i>bấy giờ</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Then, that time</b></font><ul><li><b>bấy giờ là năm 1945</b>: it was 1945 then, that was the year 1945</li><li><b>làm xong việc đó bấy giờ sẽ hay</b>: let's get that work done, then we shall see</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấy lâu<html><i>bấy lâu</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> For so long, since that long</b></font><ul><li><b>chờ đợi bấy lâu</b>: To wait for so long</li><li><b>bấy lâu mới được một dịp</b>: for so long, there has not been such an opportunity</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấy nay<html><i>bấy nay</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> From then till now</b></font><ul><li><b>kể đà thiểu não lòng người bấy nay</b>: how grieved one's heart has been from then till now</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bấy nhiêu<html><i>bấy nhiêu</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> So much, that much</b></font><ul><li><b>chỉ cần bấy nhiêu</b>: that much will do</li><li><b>Năm năm mới bấy nhiêu ngày, Mà trong trời đất đổi thay đã nhiều</b>: Only five years, only that much time, But so many changes have occurred to our land</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bầm<html><i>bầm</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (cũ) Mama</b></font><ul></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> bluish black</b></font><ul><li><b>môi tím bầm lại</b>: lips turning bluish black</li><li><b>bị đánh bầm cả người</b>: to be beaten black and blue</li><li><b>áo nâu bầm</b>: a black brown jacket</li><li><b>đỏ bầm</b>: purple</li><li><b>bầm gan tím ruột</b>: black in the face (with rage), purple with anger</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bần<html><i>bần</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Cork</b></font><ul><li><b>nút bần</b>: a cork</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Poor</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bần bật<html><i>bần bật</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Tremulous</b></font><ul><li><b>chân tay run bần bật như lên cơn sốt</b>: his limbs trembled tremulously like in a fit of fever</li><li><b>bom nổ, ngôi nhà run lên bần bật</b>: at the bomb explosion, the house quivered tremulously</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bần cùng<html><i>bần cùng</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Destitude, abjectly poor</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Driven to extremity</b></font><ul><li><b>bần cùng lắm mới phải bỏ một buổi sản xuất</b>: to miss a work session as a last extremity</li></ul></li></ul></html>

bần sĩ<html><i>bần sĩ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> pronoun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> This humble scholar</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bần thần<html><i>bần thần</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Haggard, worried</b></font><ul><li><b>vẻ mặt bần thần</b>: to look haggard</li><li><b>mong mãi không thấy con về, chị ấy bần thần cả buổi chiều</b>: she was worried the whole afternoon, waiting in vain for her child</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bần tiện<html><i>bần tiện</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Poor, poverty-stricken</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Mean, ignoble</b></font><ul><li><b>con người bần tiện</b>: a mean person</li><li><b>việc làm bần tiện</b>: a mean action</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bần tăng<html><i>bần tăng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> pronoun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> This humble monk, this humble bonze</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bần đạo<html><i>bần đạo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> pronoun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> This humble hermit</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bầu<html><i>bầu</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Gourd</b></font><ul><li><b>Bầu ơi, thương lấy bí cùng Tuy rằng khác giống, nhưng chung một giàn</b>: Oh gourd, love the pumpkin, Though of different species, you share the same trellis</li><li><b>bầu rượu</b>: a winegourd</li><li><b>bầu đèn</b>: a lamp reservoir</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Ovary</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Breastful</b></font><ul><li><b>thanh niên có sẵn một bầu nhiệt huyết</b>: youth has always a breastful of enthusiasm ready</li><li><b>dốc bầu tâm sự</b>: to tell all one's confidences</li><li><b>bầu rượu túi thơ</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bậy<html><i>bậy</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Brazen</b></font><ul><li><b>đã trái lý còn cãi bậy</b>: though in the wrong, he still brazenly argued</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Wrong, nonsensical, improper</b></font><ul><li><b>nói bậy</b>: to talk improperly, to talk nonsense</li><li><b>đừng vẽ bậy lên tường</b>: don't make improper drawings on the walls; no improper graphiti on the walls</li><li><b>bậy! đừng nghĩ vớ vẩn</b>: nonsense! don't think of absurdities</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bậy bạ<html><i>bậy bạ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> như bậy</b></font><ul><li><b>nói bậy bạ</b>: to talk nonsense</li><li><b>làm những việc bậy bạ</b>: to do objectionable things</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bằng<html><i>bằng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Eagle, hero in his element</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Warrant, testimonial, evidence, proof</b></font><ul><li><b>lấy gì làm bằng?</b>: what is the warrant?</li><li><b>có đủ giấy tờ làm bằng</b>: There are all the necessary testimonials</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Diploma, certificate, licence</b></font><ul><li><b>bằng tốt nghiệp đại học</b>: a university graduate's diploma</li><li><b>bằng lái xe</b>: a driving licence</li><li><b>cấp bằng khen</b>: to confer a certificate of merit</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Even, level</b></font><ul><li><b>san đất cho bằng</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bằng bặn<html><i>bằng bặn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Even and uniform</b></font><ul><li><b>mái lợp bằng bặn</b>: an even and uniform roof</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng chân<html><i>bằng chân</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (cũng Bằng chân như vại, bình chân như vại) Remain unconcerned (while others are in distress)</b></font></li></ul></html>
bằng chứng<html><i>bằng chứng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Evidence, proof, exhibit</b></font><ul><li><b>những bằng chứng về tội ác của bọn khủng bố</b>: exhibits of the terrorists' crimes</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng cấp<html><i>bằng cấp</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Diploma</b></font><ul><li><b>tư tưởng bằng cấp</b>: diploma-mindedness</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng cớ<html><i>bằng cớ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Evidence, proof</b></font><ul><li><b>đưa ra những bằng cớ không thể chối cãi</b>: to produce irrefutable evidence</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng cứ<html><i>bằng cứ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To rely on the strength of, to base oneself on</b></font><ul><li><b>bằng cứ vào tài liệu, có thể khẳng định được điều đó</b>: relying on the strength of the documents, we can affirm that</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng hữu<html><i>bằng hữu</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Friends</b></font><ul><li><b>tình bằng hữu</b>: friendship, friendly feeling</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng không<html><i>bằng không</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Otherwise, [or] else</b></font><ul><li><b>Biết thì làm, bằng không thì phải hỏi</b>: If one knows how, one can do it, otherwise one must ask</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>It's a mere waste of efforts; it's just labour lost</b></font></li></ul></html>
bằng lòng<html><i>bằng lòng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Satisfied, content, agreeable</b></font><ul><li><b>bằng lòng cho ai mượn sách</b>: to be agreeable to lend someone a book, to agree to lend someone a book</li><li><b>không bằng lòng với những thành tích đã đạt được</b>: not satisfied with the achievements recorded</li><li><b>bằng mặt mà chẳng bằng lòng</b>: to be agreeable only in appearance</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bằng như<html><i>bằng như</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (tiếng địa phương) If; otherwise</b></font></li></ul></html>

bề<html><i>bề</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Side, dimension</b></font><ul><li><b>cái sân vuông mỗi bề đo được bảy mét</b>: a square yard, 7 meters long each side</li><li><b>ba bề là nước</b>: there is water on three sides</li><li><b>bốn bề lặng ngắt</b>: quiet on four (all) sides</li><li><b>bề cao</b>: height</li><li><b>bề dầy</b>: thickness</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Respect; aspect</b></font><ul><li><b>khổ cực trăm bề</b>: a very hard life in every respect</li><li><b>đời sống có bề dễ chịu hơn</b>: in some respect, the living condition is better</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề bề<html><i>bề bề</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Plentiful</b></font><ul><li><b>ruộng bề bề không bằng một nghề trong tay</b>: a trade is better than plenty of fields</li><li><b>công việc bề bề</b>: plenty of work to do</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề bộn<html><i>bề bộn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Jumbled, in a jumble</b></font><ul><li><b>đồ đạc để bề bộn</b>: furniture in a jumble</li><li><b>nhiều ý nghĩ bề bộn trong đầu óc</b>: there is a jumble of ideas in the head</li><li><b>bề bộn trăm công nghìn việc</b>: there are heaps of work to do</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề cao<html><i>bề cao</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Height</b></font></li></ul></html>
bề dài<html><i>bề dài</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Length</b></font></li></ul></html>
bề dọc<html><i>bề dọc</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Length</b></font></li></ul></html>
bề mặt<html><i>bề mặt</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Area, surface</b></font><ul><li><b>bề mặt hình chữ nhựt</b>: a rectangle's surface</li><li><b>bề mặt trái đất</b>: the area of the earth</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề ngang<html><i>bề ngang</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Breadth, width</b></font></li></ul></html>
bề ngoài<html><i>bề ngoài</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Exterior, outward</b></font><ul><li><b>sức mạnh bề ngoài của chủ nghĩa quốc xã</b>: the outward strength of nazism</li><li><b>Bề ngoài thơn thớt nói cười Mà trong nham hiểm giết người không dao</b>: Outwardly a honey tongue, Inwardly a heart of gall</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề sâu<html><i>bề sâu</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Depth</b></font></li></ul></html>
bề thế<html><i>bề thế</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Influence (deriving from a high position)</b></font><ul><li><b>lớp người có bề thế trong xã hội</b>: the influential section in the old society, the people with a long arm in the old society, the persons of rank and fashion in the old society</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Great size, magnitude, great dimensions</b></font><ul><li><b>bề thế rộng lớn của nông trường</b>: the great size of the farm</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Influential</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Sizeable</b></font><ul><li><b>ngôi nhà bề thế</b>: a large house</li><li><b>đứng xa trông cơ ngơi rất bề thế</b>: from a distance, the estate's proportions look sizeable</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề trên<html><i>bề trên</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Superior</b></font><ul><li><b>Vâng lời bề trên</b>: To obey one's siperiors</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bề tôi<html><i>bề tôi</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Subject, vassal</b></font><ul><li><b>một bề tôi trung thành</b>: a loyal subject</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bền<html><i>bền</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Strong, solid, fast, long-wearing</b></font><ul><li><b>sợi chỉ bền</b>: strong thread</li><li><b>vải nhuộm bền màu</b>: dyed cloth of fast colours</li><li><b>ăn chắc mặc bền</b>: eat stodgy food, dress is long-wearing clothes</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Enduring, long-lasting</b></font><ul><li><b>Không có việc gì khó, Chỉ sợ lòng không bền</b>: No job is hard if one's will is enduring; When there is a will, there is a´way</li><li><b>của phi nghĩa không thể bền được</b>: ill-gotten gains can never last long</li><li><b>bền gan chiến đấu</b>: to fight enduringly</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bền bỉ<html><i>bền bỉ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Enduring</b></font><ul><li><b>sức bền bỉ của con người</b>: man's endurance, man's staying-power</li><li><b>cuộc đấu tranh bền bỉ</b>: an enduring struggle</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bị thịt<html><i>bị thịt</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (thông tục) Lubber, dolt; good-for-nothing</b></font><ul><li><b>Đồ bị thịt!</b>: What a dolt!</li><li><b>"Thằng vua bị thịt biết gì là ê " (Tú Mỡ)</b>: That lubber of a king was lost a shame</li></ul></li></ul></html>

bỏ mẹ<html><i>bỏ mẹ</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To death</b></font><ul><li><b>đánh bỏ mẹ nó đi!</b>: beat him to death!</li><li><b>nó dỗi không ăn à, để cho nó đói bỏ mẹ nó đi!</b>: he is sulking and refusing to eat, isn't he? Let him starve to death!</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Damn it! Damn, damned</b></font><ul><li><b>canh gác thế thì bỏ mẹ!</b>: damn such a way of mounting guard!</li><li><b>bỏ mẹ! máy lại hỏng rồi!</b>: damn it! the machine is again out of order!</li><li><b>phiền bỏ mẹ</b>: damned annoying!</li><li><b>sướng bỏ mẹ đi, còn đòi gì nữa!</b>: he's too damned happy to expect more!</li></ul></li></ul></html>

bỏ phí<html><i>bỏ phí</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Waste</b></font><ul><li><b>Bỏ phí thời giờ</b>: to waste one's time</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bỏ qua<html><i>bỏ qua</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To let slip, to miss</b></font><ul><li><b>bỏ qua một dịp may hiếm có</b>: to let slip a rare opportunity, to miss a golden opportunity</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To let pass unnoticed</b></font><ul><li><b>không thể bỏ qua những vấn đề nguyên tắc</b>: one should not let matters of principle pass unnoticed</li><li><b>cháu trót dại, xin bác bỏ qua</b>: that child was a fool, please forget about it</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To bypass</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bỏ quá<html><i>bỏ quá</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To pardon, to forgive</b></font><ul><li><b>tôi lỡ lời, xin bỏ quá cho</b>: it was a slip of the tongue on my part, please pardon me</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bỏ quên<html><i>bỏ quên</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Forget, leave</b></font><ul><li><b>Bỏ quên ví ở nhà</b>: To leave one's wallet at home</li></ul></li></ul></html>
bỏ rơi<html><i>bỏ rơi</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To leave far behind</b></font><ul><li><b>xe trước chạy nhanh, bỏ rơi những xe sau</b>: the lead car drove fast and left the following ones far behind</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To let down</b></font><ul><li><b>tập thể không bỏ rơi người mắc sai lầm</b>: the community will not let down those who have made mistakes</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bỏ rẻ<html><i>bỏ rẻ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> khẩu ngữ</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> At the lowest</b></font><ul><li><b>mỗi sào bỏ rẻ cũng được vài trăm cân thóc</b>: each sao at the lowest will yield several hundred kilos of paddy</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bốn<html><i>bốn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> number</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Four, fourth</b></font><ul><li><b>một năm có bốn mùa</b>: there are four seasons in a year</li><li><b>một trăm lẻ bốn</b>: a hundred and four</li><li><b>châu á gấp bốn lần châu âu</b>: Asia is four times larger than Europe</li><li><b>đợt bốn</b>: round four, the fourth round</li><li><b>bốn tám</b>: forty-eight</li><li><b>xe bốn bánh</b>: a four-wheeler</li><li><b>thú bốn chân</b>: a quadruped</li><li><b>bốn dài hai ngắn</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bốn biển<html><i>bốn biển</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> The four corners of the earth, the five continents, the whole world</b></font><ul><li><b>bốn biển một nhà</b>: the whole world is one family</li><li><b>khắp năm châu bốn biển</b>: to the four corners of the earth, over the five continents, all over the world</li></ul></li></ul></html>

bống<html><i>bống</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> xem cá bống</b></font></li></ul></html>
bốp<html><i>bốp</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Pop</b></font><ul><li><b>nổ bốp và toé lửa</b>: to pop and spark</li><li><b>tát đánh bốp một cái</b>: to slap (someone's face) with a pop</li><li><b>vỗ tay bôm bốp</b>: pop, pop, went the applause</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To tell straight in (someone's) face</b></font><ul><li><b>nổi cáu, bốp luôn mấy câu</b>: flying into a temper, he told straight into his face a few pieces of his mind</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Swell</b></font><ul><li><b>diện thật bốp vào</b>: to array oneself in one's swell clothes</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bốp chát<html><i>bốp chát</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To be bluntly outspoken, to talk back bluntly</b></font><ul><li><b>giọng từ tốn không bốp chát</b>: to speak in a mild tone and not in a bluntly outspoken way</li><li><b>có tính hay bốp chát, sống vui tính và thẳng thắn</b>: to be bluntly outspoken, but jovial and straightforward</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bốt<html><i>bốt</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (như bót) Small post</b></font><ul><li><b>bốt gác</b>: a small watching post</li><li><b>giặc đóng hai bốt trong làng</b>: the enemy set up two small posts in the village</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Boot</b></font><ul><li><b>mang bốt</b>: to wear boots</li><li><b>đi bốt cao su</b>: to wear rubber boots</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bộ<html><i>bộ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Appearance, look, carriage, gait</b></font><ul><li><b>trong bộ đi cũng nhận được người quen</b>: to recognize an acquaintance from the gait</li><li><b>coi bộ trời sắp mưa</b>: it looks like rain</li><li><b>rung đùi ra bộ đắc ý</b>: to stir one's knee with a satisfied look</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Capability (hàm ý coi thường)</b></font><ul><li><b>bộ nó mà làm gì được</b>: judging from his appearance, his capability is not great; he does not seem very capable</li><li><b>lớn rồi chứ bộ còn con nít sao!</b>: you are quite grown up, you don't look a child any more</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Set</b></font><ul><li><b>bộ xương</b>: a set of bones, a skeleton</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

bợn<html><i>bợn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Flaw, impurity</b></font><ul><li><b>gương xấu có nhiều bợn</b>: a looking-glass of an indifferent kind with many flaws</li><li><b>nước trong không chút bợn</b>: the water was pure, free of impurities</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Soiled, tainted</b></font><ul><li><b>nhà rất sạch, không bợn chút rác</b>: the house was very clean, not soiled by a single bit of garbage; the house was spotless clean</li><li><b>lòng công minh, không bợn chút tư tình</b>: his fairness was not tainted by any partiality</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bợp<html><i>bợp</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> như bớp</b></font></li></ul></html>
bợt<html><i>bợt</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Frayed</b></font><ul><li><b>chiếc áo cũ bợt đi ở vai</b>: the old jacket frayed on the shoulders</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Faded</b></font><ul><li><b>lá cờ bợt màu</b>: a faded flag</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Pale</b></font><ul><li><b>nước da bợt</b>: a pale complexion</li><li><b>trắng bợt</b>: pale white</li><li><b>mặt xanh bợt</b>: a pale face</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bụ<html><i>bụ</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Plump, chubby, sappy</b></font><ul><li><b>cổ tay em bé bụ</b>: the baby's wrists were plump</li><li><b>chọn những cây bụ đem trồng</b>: to pick out sappy saplings for planting</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bụ bẫm<html><i>bụ bẫm</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Plump, chubby, sappy</b></font><ul><li><b>khuôn mặt cháu bé bụ bẫm</b>: the baby's face is chubby, the baby has got a chubby face</li><li><b>những búp măng bụ bẫm</b>: sappy bamboo shoots</li></ul></li></ul></html>

bứt<html><i>bứt</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To tear, to snatch, to pluck</b></font><ul><li><b>bứt tóc</b>: to tear one's hair</li><li><b>bứt tóc ai</b>: to snatch someone's hair</li><li><b>bứt lá</b>: to pluck a leaf</li><li><b>bứt ra khỏi hàng ngũ</b>: to tear oneself away from the ranks, to bread rank</li><li><b>tính anh ta hễ vào việc là đừng hòng bứt ra được</b>: it is his character that when having begun his work he is not to be torn away from it</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To cut</b></font><ul><li><b>bứt cỏ quên liềm</b>: to leave one's sickle after cutting grass</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bứt rứt<html><i>bứt rứt</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Fidgety, uneasy, restless</b></font><ul><li><b>trong người bứt rứt</b>: To fidget</li><li><b>ngồi không đã lâu, chân tay bứt rứt</b>: after sitting idle for a long time, he fidgeted</li><li><b>điều sơ suất ấy vẫn cứ làm cho anh ta bứt rứt</b>: that false step of his still made him fidget</li><li><b>bứt rứt trong lòng vì không giúp được bạn</b>: he felt fidgety in his heart for not having been able to help his friend</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bừa<html><i>bừa</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Rake</b></font><ul><li><b>kéo bừa</b>: to draw a rake</li><li><b>đóng bừa cải tiến</b>: to make improved rakes</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To rake</b></font><ul><li><b>cày sâu bừa kỹ</b>: to plough deep and rake carefully</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Topsy-turvy</b></font><ul><li><b>giấy má bỏ bừa trong ngăn kéo</b>: papers are topsy-turvy in the drawer</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Rash, easy-going, (at) random</b></font><ul><li><b>không hiểu chớ trả lời bừa</b>: when one is not clear, one should not give any rash answer</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bừa bãi<html><i>bừa bãi</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> như bừa</b></font><ul><li><b>đồ đạc để bừa bãi</b>: the furniture is topsy-turvy</li><li><b>ăn nói bừa bãi</b>: to be rash in one's speech</li><li><b>nếp sống bừa bãi</b>: an easy-going way of living</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
bừa bộn<html><i>bừa bộn</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Lying about disorderly, littering</b></font><ul><li><b>quần áo vứt bừa bộn khắp nơi</b>: clothing lying about disorderly everywhere</li><li><b>nhà cửa bừa bộn giấy má đồ đạc</b>: the house was littered with papers and pieces of furniture</li></ul></li></ul></html>

ca ngoi<html><i>ca ngợi</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To sing the praise of, to extol</b></font><ul><li><b>ca ngợi cảnh đẹp của đất nước</b>: to sing the praise of the country's beautiful sceneries</li><li><b>bài thơ ca ngợi người lao động</b>: a poem in praise of labourers</li><li><b>một hành động đáng ca ngợi</b>: a praiseworthy deed</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

ca tinh hoa<html><i>cá tính hoá</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To individualize, to individuate</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
ca trau<html><i>cá tràu</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> như cá quả</b></font></li></ul></html>
ca tre<html><i>cá trê</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Catfish</b></font></li></ul></html>

ca troi<html><i>cá trôi</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Major cap</b></font></li></ul></html>
ca tru<html><i>ca trù</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Ca Trù - an original art performance of academic character - has been preserved for the past 10 centuries.To appreciate Ca Trù is to appreciate poetry and music. Ca Trù appeared officially under Nhà Hậu Lý (11th century). First, it served royal and religious rituals and was called Hát Khuôn. Later, it was used in banquets, weddings, friendly meetings... and called Hát Hàng Hoạ Ca Trù had bamboo castanets as principal+instrument. By beating time on tomtoms, spectators accompanied and praised the singer. Ca Trù was also called Hát Nhà Trò (singing or dancing while pulling funny tricks), Hát Thưởng (Singing to be rewarded by king or mandarins), Hát Cửa Quyền (singing in royal palaces), Hát Cửa Đình (singing for religious rituals), Hát ả đào (name of a famous songstress in the Lý times).... Under the French domination, Ca Trù declined. Nowadays, it is restored as a type of original popular art</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> What is a Ca Trù declamation? Originally, Ca Trù was like chèo singing and served at ceremonies and festivals in the northern delta. When these ceremonies and festivals were no longer held, Ca Trù became a type of chamber music serving as intellectual food for those who would like to enjoy music and poetry</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Music and poetry are the basis of Ca Trù and decide which ensemble of principal instruments, musicians and subordinate instruments should provide the accompaniment. Ca Trù has many melodies that are sung differently, but the chief is singing-reciting: A singer and a musician playing a long-necked lute-like instrument. Also taking part is a member of the audience who expresses his appreciation and response by beating a drum. A rather special description fits the songstress of former days: "Fine clothes, velvet turban, delicate bobtailed hair, a moon-shaped face, knife-sharp eyes, refined manners, with sweet words, mild as flowers, transparent as snow, her beauty and charm are second only to Kim Vân Kiều's..." To perform as expected, the+singer must practise very hard and know many tunes. A male musician accompanies the singer. He too practises hard so as to be in perfect harmony with the singer. The music accompaniment consists of a "phách" - a bamboo instrument beaten with two wooden sticks - and "trống chầu" - a drum beaten by a member of the audience in appreciation or comment. Of course, this member of the audience is very experienced at beating the drum - a single beat, three or five successive beats and nine beats at the climax to be "in tune" with the lute. A timely response by the drummer encourages the singer who knows that she has met someone who both understands and appreciates her talent. These three instruments: The lute, the "phách" and the "trống chầu" are inseparable. Being a subordinate+instrument, the drum is essential as a bridge between the performer and audience. The harmonious combination of the lute, the "phách" and the+human voice makes it a perfect performance as praised in these lines by Vũ Hoàng Chương: Sweet phach, passionate lute mild smoke cushion. The sad voice lingers on in the middle of night. To enjoy Ca Trù is to enjoy both music and singing. The art of Ca Trù is both high and original. Its sound range originates from that of the lullaby in the Red River delta. Ca Trù - with water puppetry - is+indigenous to Vietnam. It is a valuable legacy for Vietnamese culture</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Many talented poets like Chu Mạnh Trinh, Nguyễn Công Trứ, Tú Xương, Dương Khuê and Tản Đà composed excellent tunes, extraordinarily pure and high-falutin to charm the audience.+At the beginning of the 20th century, before the 1945, there were many places where Ca Trù was performed: Khâm Thiên, Bồ Đề, Lộ Khê (Hanoi); Quan Ba Mau, Quỳnh Cư (Hải Phòng) and throughout Bắc Ninh, Hải Dương and Nam Định provinces. But then, Ca Trù became Cô Đầu - performed by a sing-song girl or type of geisha. The art of Ca Trù was forgotten because it was thought to be a product of the ruling+class; the singers whores and the audience no more than hedonists. Singers abandoned their careers because of this bias and inhabitants of the Khâm Thiên area even left their homes because of it. Before 1976, musician Nguyễn Xuân Khoát was the only Vietnamese musicologist to study Ca Trù. Ca Trù artists are still rare now, but attention is being given their art. Lộ Khê village, Phu Do (in Hà Nội) is considered the cradle of Ca Trù and on the 6th of the 4th lunar month and the 13th of the tenth lunar month each year, members of the Ca Trù circle hold initiator-worshipping celebrations Artists young and old sing the Ca Trù, always beginning with two pieces: Non Mai and Hồng Hạnh.+The artist who deserves most praise for the revival and world-wide spread of Ca Trù is Doctor-Professor Trần Văn Khệ He has recorded Ca Trù, Quan Họ and chèo songs and declamations and sent them to France for the UNESCO Musical Committee to study. As a result, many recordings of Ca Trù and Quan Họ songs have been made. The support of eminent artist Quách Thị Hồ has made the recordings a great success. All the original features of Ca Trù are prominent, and Hồ was evaluated by the Musical+Committee and awarded with an honorary commendation with these lines: "We thank you for your contribution to the keeping of an original, traditional art legacy of Vietnam and an exceptional delicacy of mankind". Since then, Vietnam has sent a delegation to an Asian tribute held in the People's Democratic Republic of Korea where Ho^`'s recordings were among the most honoured. A Ca Trù club has been established in Hà Nội, a place for all of Vietnam's excellent Ca Trù artists. It not only revives an old+musical form but attracts foreign musicologists: American, English, German and Japanese. American researcher Mirada Krenzen has written a persuasive study, Vietnam's Traditional Music Process. It was presented at a seminar to discuss Vietnam's traditional music in Hà Nội in 1994. Krenzen possesses a deep knowledge of Ca Trù and has gained the admiration of Vietnamese musicologists. She wrote: "Ca Trù seems to have a magic power, a fermented substance to charm the listeners. Once I understood Ca Trù, I understood the Vietnamese people better". It is possible that Ca Trù is a patch of the Vietnamese soul that Krenzen has understood? ()</b></font></li></ul></html>
ca trù<html><i>ca trù</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Ca Trù - an original art performance of academic character - has been preserved for the past 10 centuries.To appreciate Ca Trù is to appreciate poetry and music. Ca Trù appeared officially under Nhà Hậu Lý (11th century). First, it served royal and religious rituals and was called Hát Khuôn. Later, it was used in banquets, weddings, friendly meetings... and called Hát Hàng Hoạ Ca Trù had bamboo castanets as principal+instrument. By beating time on tomtoms, spectators accompanied and praised the singer. Ca Trù was also called Hát Nhà Trò (singing or dancing while pulling funny tricks), Hát Thưởng (Singing to be rewarded by king or mandarins), Hát Cửa Quyền (singing in royal palaces), Hát Cửa Đình (singing for religious rituals), Hát ả đào (name of a famous songstress in the Lý times).... Under the French domination, Ca Trù declined. Nowadays, it is restored as a type of original popular art</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> What is a Ca Trù declamation? Originally, Ca Trù was like chèo singing and served at ceremonies and festivals in the northern delta. When these ceremonies and festivals were no longer held, Ca Trù became a type of chamber music serving as intellectual food for those who would like to enjoy music and poetry</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Music and poetry are the basis of Ca Trù and decide which ensemble of principal instruments, musicians and subordinate instruments should provide the accompaniment. Ca Trù has many melodies that are sung differently, but the chief is singing-reciting: A singer and a musician playing a long-necked lute-like instrument. Also taking part is a member of the audience who expresses his appreciation and response by beating a drum. A rather special description fits the songstress of former days: "Fine clothes, velvet turban, delicate bobtailed hair, a moon-shaped face, knife-sharp eyes, refined manners, with sweet words, mild as flowers, transparent as snow, her beauty and charm are second only to Kim Vân Kiều's..." To perform as expected, the+singer must practise very hard and know many tunes. A male musician accompanies the singer. He too practises hard so as to be in perfect harmony with the singer. The music accompaniment consists of a "phách" - a bamboo instrument beaten with two wooden sticks - and "trống chầu" - a drum beaten by a member of the audience in appreciation or comment. Of course, this member of the audience is very experienced at beating the drum - a single beat, three or five successive beats and nine beats at the climax to be "in tune" with the lute. A timely response by the drummer encourages the singer who knows that she has met someone who both understands and appreciates her talent. These three instruments: The lute, the "phách" and the "trống chầu" are inseparable. Being a subordinate+instrument, the drum is essential as a bridge between the performer and audience. The harmonious combination of the lute, the "phách" and the+human voice makes it a perfect performance as praised in these lines by Vũ Hoàng Chương: Sweet phach, passionate lute mild smoke cushion. The sad voice lingers on in the middle of night. To enjoy Ca Trù is to enjoy both music and singing. The art of Ca Trù is both high and original. Its sound range originates from that of the lullaby in the Red River delta. Ca Trù - with water puppetry - is+indigenous to Vietnam. It is a valuable legacy for Vietnamese culture</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Many talented poets like Chu Mạnh Trinh, Nguyễn Công Trứ, Tú Xương, Dương Khuê and Tản Đà composed excellent tunes, extraordinarily pure and high-falutin to charm the audience.+At the beginning of the 20th century, before the 1945, there were many places where Ca Trù was performed: Khâm Thiên, Bồ Đề, Lộ Khê (Hanoi); Quan Ba Mau, Quỳnh Cư (Hải Phòng) and throughout Bắc Ninh, Hải Dương and Nam Định provinces. But then, Ca Trù became Cô Đầu - performed by a sing-song girl or type of geisha. The art of Ca Trù was forgotten because it was thought to be a product of the ruling+class; the singers whores and the audience no more than hedonists. Singers abandoned their careers because of this bias and inhabitants of the Khâm Thiên area even left their homes because of it. Before 1976, musician Nguyễn Xuân Khoát was the only Vietnamese musicologist to study Ca Trù. Ca Trù artists are still rare now, but attention is being given their art. Lộ Khê village, Phu Do (in Hà Nội) is considered the cradle of Ca Trù and on the 6th of the 4th lunar month and the 13th of the tenth lunar month each year, members of the Ca Trù circle hold initiator-worshipping celebrations Artists young and old sing the Ca Trù, always beginning with two pieces: Non Mai and Hồng Hạnh.+The artist who deserves most praise for the revival and world-wide spread of Ca Trù is Doctor-Professor Trần Văn Khệ He has recorded Ca Trù, Quan Họ and chèo songs and declamations and sent them to France for the UNESCO Musical Committee to study. As a result, many recordings of Ca Trù and Quan Họ songs have been made. The support of eminent artist Quách Thị Hồ has made the recordings a great success. All the original features of Ca Trù are prominent, and Hồ was evaluated by the Musical+Committee and awarded with an honorary commendation with these lines: "We thank you for your contribution to the keeping of an original, traditional art legacy of Vietnam and an exceptional delicacy of mankind". Since then, Vietnam has sent a delegation to an Asian tribute held in the People's Democratic Republic of Korea where Ho^`'s recordings were among the most honoured. A Ca Trù club has been established in Hà Nội, a place for all of Vietnam's excellent Ca Trù artists. It not only revives an old+musical form but attracts foreign musicologists: American, English, German and Japanese. American researcher Mirada Krenzen has written a persuasive study, Vietnam's Traditional Music Process. It was presented at a seminar to discuss Vietnam's traditional music in Hà Nội in 1994. Krenzen possesses a deep knowledge of Ca Trù and has gained the admiration of Vietnamese musicologists. She wrote: "Ca Trù seems to have a magic power, a fermented substance to charm the listeners. Once I understood Ca Trù, I understood the Vietnamese people better". It is possible that Ca Trù is a patch of the Vietnamese soul that Krenzen has understood? ()</b></font></li></ul></html>

can đảm<html><i>can đảm</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Courageous</b></font><ul><li><b>can đảm chịu nỗi đau thương</b>: to endure the grief courageously</li><li><b>em bé can đảm dám đi đêm một mình</b>: the little boy is very courageous, he does not mind going by himself in the dark</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Courage</b></font><ul><li><b>"Chúng ta có đầy đủ sức mạnh, can đảm và thông minh để xây dựng cuộc sống mới của mình"</b>: we have enough strength, courage and intelligence to build for ourselves a new life</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
cang<html><i>càng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Chela, claw, nipper, pincers</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Shaft</b></font><ul><li><b>càng xe bò</b>: an ox-cart shaft</li><li><b>càng xe cút kích</b>: a wheelbarrow shaft</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adv</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (dùng trước động từ, tính từ) All the more, all the...-er</b></font><ul><li><b>có gió, lửa càng bốc to</b>: a wind rose, so the fire mounted all the higher</li><li><b>Chúng ta vui sướng hôm nay, Càng nên nhớ lại những ngày gian lao</b>: as we are happy today, we all the more have to remember the hard days of the past</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>The more...; the...-er the...-er</b></font><ul><li><b>bản nhạc càng nghe càng thấy hay</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

cha<html><i>cha</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Father, dad</b></font><ul><li><b>Đức Cha</b>: Right Reverend Father</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Damn, curse</b></font><ul><li><b>Cha đời cái áo rách này Mất chúng mất bạn vì mày áo ơi</b>: Damn this ragged jacket which has cost me friends and acquaintances</li><li><b>cha nào con nấy</b>: like father like son</li><li><b>cha căng chú kiết</b>: of unknown origin; not to be trusted</li><li><b>cha chung không ai khóc</b>: everybody's business is nobody's business</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

cha ran<html><i>chả rán</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Fried crab roll, fried meat roll</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Although it ranks among Vietnam's special dishes, Cha Ran (or Cha Gio) is very easy to prepare. Consequently, it has long been a preferred food on special occasions such as Tet and other family festivities. Ingredients for Cha Gio comprise lean minced pork, sea crabs or unshelled shrimps, two kinds of edible mushroom - Nam Huong and Moc Nhi - dried onion, duck eggs, pepper, salt and seasoning. All are mixed thoroughly before being wrapped with transparent rice paper into small rooms. These rolls are fried in boiling oil. Pieces of freshly fried spring rolls, dipped in spicy, sweet and sour fish sauce and can offer connoisseurs a tasty hot food to be eaten with a variety of pickles including slices of papaya and lettuce, cucumber and other spicy vegetables</b></font></li></ul></html>

chap choang<html><i>chập choạng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Half-light, twilight</b></font><ul><li><b>trời vừa chập choạng tối</b>: it was twilight</li><li><b>ánh sáng chập choạng của hoàng hôn</b>: the half-light of dusk</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Unsteady, tottering</b></font><ul><li><b>những bước đi chập choạng của người mù</b>: the unsteady steps of the blind</li><li><b>đi chập choạng trong đêm tối</b>: to totter in the dark, to grope one's way in the dark</li><li><b>con dơi bay chập choạng</b>: the bat flies unsteadily</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chap choi<html><i>chấp chới</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To fly with a rolling motion</b></font><ul><li><b>bướm chấp chới bay liệng</b>: the butterfly flew with a rolling motion and hovered</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To flicker</b></font><ul><li><b>ánh đuốc chấp chới ở phía xa</b>: the glimmer of a torch flickered in the distance</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To wink leeringly</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chap chon<html><i>chập chờn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To doze</b></font><ul><li><b>mỗi đêm chỉ chập chờn được vài ba tiếng đồng hồ</b>: to doze a few hours every night</li><li><b>giấc ngủ chập chờn</b>: a broken sleep</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To flicker</b></font><ul><li><b>ánh lửa chập chờn như sắp tắt</b>: the glow flickered as if it was going out</li><li><b>những hình ảnh của quê hương cứ chập chờn trước mắt</b>: images of the native land flickered before his eyes</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chap chung<html><i>chập chững</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Toddling</b></font><ul><li><b>tập đi từng bước chập chững</b>: to learn how to walk by toddling</li><li><b>em bé mới chập chững biết đi</b>: the baby still toddles, the child is a toddler</li><li><b>còn chập chững trong nghề</b>: still a toddler in the trade, still a green born in the trade</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chenh<html><i>chênh</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Tilted</b></font><ul><li><b>bàn kê chênh</b>: the table is tilted</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Uneven, of different levels</b></font><ul><li><b>chênh nhau vài tuổi</b>: there is a difference of a few years between them</li><li><b>giá hàng không chênh nhau bao nhiêu</b>: the prices of goods are not very different in level</li><li><b>mực nước hai bên cống chênh nhau một mét</b>: there is a difference of one meter between the levels of the water on both sides of the culvert</li><li><b>chênh sức</b>: of uneven strength</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chenh choang<html><i>chếnh choáng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Tipsy, squiffy</b></font><ul><li><b>mới uống lưng chén rượu mà đã thấy chếnh choáng</b>: to feel tipsy after drinking only half a cup of wine</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chenh lech<html><i>chênh lệch</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Uneven, unequal, of different levels</b></font><ul><li><b>giá cả chênh lệch</b>: the prices are of different levels</li><li><b>lực lượng hai bên rất chênh lệch</b>: both sides' strength is very unequal</li><li><b>khắc phục tình trạng trồng trọt và chăn nuôi phát triển còn chênh lệch nhau</b>: to do away with the still uneven development of crop growing and animal husbandry</li></ul></li></ul></html>

chi phoi<html><i>chi phối</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To control, to rule, to govern</b></font><ul><li><b>tư tưởng chi phối hành động</b>: ideology rules over behaviour</li><li><b>thế giới quan của nhà văn chi phối nội dung tư tưởng của tác phẩm</b>: the writer's world outlook rules over the ideological content of the work</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chieng<html><i>chiêng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Gong</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Gongs were found in Vietnam in the Bronze Age (Đông Sơn culture from 2000 to 3500 years ago). Gongs were cast in bronze, an alloy of copper, zinc and lead. Gongs are used as a musical instrument by most ethnic groups in Vietnam. Gongs are frequently mentioned in Highland songs, and its music displays its contemplative nature. Highlanders believe that when gong music is played, there is an encounter between the human and spirit worlds, between the worlds of the living and the dead. In real life, the gong is closely associated with each stage of a lifespan. In the ceremony of blowing the ear for a newborn child, the sound of a gong serves to declare the offical acceptance of a new community member. When he or she is old enough to get married, in the ceremony of exchanging necklace, the gong sound is a reminder to the new couple to observe family and community traditions. The sound is so deep that it seems to ring only once in one's life. When beasts are destroying crops or a war rages, the gong seems to urge young people to dash to the battlefield and struggle for the survival of the community. If the gong sounds hilarious and fast, it heralds a victory or the ceremony of killing buffalo. When the gong sounds slow, sinister and heavy, then it is the news of a death. The gong is warm in a night of rest or around a fire with a pot of wine, an indication of a good harvest when young people gather to sing and dance and tell of their love</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>When the gong sounds from the communal house, it can be heard all over the mountain and forest as a call for the young men to return to the communal house. When an old man passes away, the gong echoes its farewell. Virtually, all Western Highland and Long Range tribes have their own gongs. There are various types: Cồng (with a nipple) and Chiêng (without one) and there are also different sizes depending on the tribe, each region with its own regulations. It would not be an exaggeration to say that the gong is one of the main instruments in the orchestras of the Western Highland (Tây Nguyên) and Long Range (Trường Sơn) tribes, used in festivals such as the welcoming of a victory, killing buffalo, forgetting a tomb, and welcoming a good harvest. There are three pieces: Juar, Trum and Vang. Juar has an accelerating tempo revealing the majestic heroism of the victory; Trum (accompanied by a shield dance) expresses the hard but brave fight of the soldiers; and Vang, with a slow tempo, tells of sorrow, grief and regret felt for fallen soldiers. Gongs are named differently according to their size, register, timbre and function: Mother Gong, Father Gong, Older Sister Gong, Younger Sister Gong, or high pitch, medium pitch and low pitch. Hands or sticks are used to beat the gong. Sticks can be wrapped with cloth and/or rubber and a gong can be held by hand, put on the thigh or hung on a frame when played. Researchers all agree that of all the gongs of the ethnic groups, the Ba Na gong is the most majestic, imposing, romantic and echoing; the Gia Rai gong is the most solid, echoing and accelerated. The gong is an instrument of a philosophical and contemplative character. Closely associated with other art forms like singing and dancing, they can also be witty, cheerful and romantic. They are not only the property of the ethnic groups of the Western Highlands and the Long Range, but also bear unique and cherished value for Vietnamese culture as a whole. ()</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chiên<html><i>chiên</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To fry</b></font><ul><li><b>chiên cá</b>: to fry fish</li><li><b>cơm chiên</b>: Cantonese rice</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Animal hair cloth (used for blankets and upholstery)</b></font><ul><li><b>tấm chiên</b>: a piece of animal hair cloth</li><li><b>chăn chiên</b>: a blanket of animal hair, a woolen blanket</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chiêng<html><i>chiêng</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Gong</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Gongs were found in Vietnam in the Bronze Age (Đông Sơn culture from 2000 to 3500 years ago). Gongs were cast in bronze, an alloy of copper, zinc and lead. Gongs are used as a musical instrument by most ethnic groups in Vietnam. Gongs are frequently mentioned in Highland songs, and its music displays its contemplative nature. Highlanders believe that when gong music is played, there is an encounter between the human and spirit worlds, between the worlds of the living and the dead. In real life, the gong is closely associated with each stage of a lifespan. In the ceremony of blowing the ear for a newborn child, the sound of a gong serves to declare the offical acceptance of a new community member. When he or she is old enough to get married, in the ceremony of exchanging necklace, the gong sound is a reminder to the new couple to observe family and community traditions. The sound is so deep that it seems to ring only once in one's life. When beasts are destroying crops or a war rages, the gong seems to urge young people to dash to the battlefield and struggle for the survival of the community. If the gong sounds hilarious and fast, it heralds a victory or the ceremony of killing buffalo. When the gong sounds slow, sinister and heavy, then it is the news of a death. The gong is warm in a night of rest or around a fire with a pot of wine, an indication of a good harvest when young people gather to sing and dance and tell of their love</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>When the gong sounds from the communal house, it can be heard all over the mountain and forest as a call for the young men to return to the communal house. When an old man passes away, the gong echoes its farewell. Virtually, all Western Highland and Long Range tribes have their own gongs. There are various types: Cồng (with a nipple) and Chiêng (without one) and there are also different sizes depending on the tribe, each region with its own regulations. It would not be an exaggeration to say that the gong is one of the main instruments in the orchestras of the Western Highland (Tây Nguyên) and Long Range (Trường Sơn) tribes, used in festivals such as the welcoming of a victory, killing buffalo, forgetting a tomb, and welcoming a good harvest. There are three pieces: Juar, Trum and Vang. Juar has an accelerating tempo revealing the majestic heroism of the victory; Trum (accompanied by a shield dance) expresses the hard but brave fight of the soldiers; and Vang, with a slow tempo, tells of sorrow, grief and regret felt for fallen soldiers. Gongs are named differently according to their size, register, timbre and function: Mother Gong, Father Gong, Older Sister Gong, Younger Sister Gong, or high pitch, medium pitch and low pitch. Hands or sticks are used to beat the gong. Sticks can be wrapped with cloth and/or rubber and a gong can be held by hand, put on the thigh or hung on a frame when played. Researchers all agree that of all the gongs of the ethnic groups, the Ba Na gong is the most majestic, imposing, romantic and echoing; the Gia Rai gong is the most solid, echoing and accelerated. The gong is an instrument of a philosophical and contemplative character. Closely associated with other art forms like singing and dancing, they can also be witty, cheerful and romantic. They are not only the property of the ethnic groups of the Western Highlands and the Long Range, but also bear unique and cherished value for Vietnamese culture as a whole. ()</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chiêu<html><i>chiêu</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> xem cô chiêu</b></font><ul></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To wash down</b></font><ul><li><b>cứ một viên thuốc lại chiêu một ngụm nước</b>: to wash down each tablet of medicine with a sip of water</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To recruit</b></font><ul></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Left</b></font><ul><li><b>tay chiêu đập niêu không vỡ</b>: the left hand cannot break an earthen pot</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chiều<html><i>chiều</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Afternoon, evening</b></font><ul><li><b>từ sáng đến chiều</b>: from morning to evening</li><li><b>ba giờ chiều</b>: three o'clock in the afternoon, three p.m</li><li><b>trời đã về chiều</b>: evening has set in</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Direction</b></font><ul><li><b>đường một chiều</b>: a one-direction road, a one-way road</li><li><b>điện xoay chiều</b>: alternating current</li><li><b>theo chiều kim đồng hồ</b>: in the direction of a clock's hand, clockwise</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Side, dimension</b></font><ul><li><b>mỗi chiều dài ba mét</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chom chom<html><i>chôm chôm</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Rambutan</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>A rambutan tree has a broad foliage and many branches. The tree yields fruit at the beginning of the rainy season in the southern provinces. The</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Chom fruit season finishes at the end of the rainy season (from May to</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>October). The skin of the fruit is tough, thick and hairy. Its pulp is transparent white and tender, and has a cool sweet taste in the mouth.The kind of rambutan most reputed nation-wide is grown in Binh Hoa Phuoc village in Long Ho district (Vinh Long province). During the rambutan season, one can notice the typical bright red colour of rambutan fruit stands located in the markets or along road intersections throughout the southern provinces</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

Khi cha mẹ, thầy học đến tuổi già, học trò, con cháu sẽ tổ chức lễ chúc thọ cha mẹ, thầy học để mong cho họ mạnh khỏe, sống lâu và mang ý nghĩa trả ơn</b>: Chúc thọ (Longevity wishing ceremony): A custom from the Khmer (Khơ-Me) community in South-Vietnam. chuyến<html><i>chuyến</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Trip, flight</b></font><ul><li><b>xe lửa chạy mỗi ngày ba chuyến</b>: there are three train trips a day</li><li><b>ba chuyến máy bay một tuần</b>: three flights a week</li><li><b>tăng chuyến hàng</b>: to increase the number of goods-carrying trips (freight)</li><li><b>chuyến đi thăm nước ngoài</b>: a (visiting) trip to a foreign country</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Time</b></font><ul><li><b>chuyến này thế nào anh ta cũng bị kỷ luật</b>: this time, he will certainly be disciplined</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

châu<html><i>châu</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Continent</b></font><ul><li><b>châu á</b>: The Asian continent</li><li><b>năm châu bốn biển</b>: the four corners of the earth; all the world</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Mountain district (thời phong kiến và thuộc Pháp)</b></font><ul><li><b>Administrative division (thời thuộc Hán-Đường)</b>: Pearl</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> (kết hợp hạn chế) Tear</b></font><ul><li><b>châu về hợp phố</b>: lost jewel returns to its owner</li><li><b>gạo châu củi quế</b>: rice as dear as pearls, firewood as dear as cinnamon; an excessively high cost of living</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To huddle together</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chèn<html><i>chèn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To chock, to make fast with</b></font><ul><li><b>chôn cọc, chèn thêm vài hòn đá</b>: to drive a skate in and make it fast with a few stones</li><li><b>chèn (bánh xe) cho khỏi lăn xuống dốc</b>: to chock a car and prevent it from rolling down the slope</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To cut in deliberately, to block</b></font><ul><li><b>chiếc xe trước chèn chiếc xe sau một cách trái phép</b>: the car in front cut in deliberately against the regulations</li><li><b>cầu thủ bóng đá chèn nhau</b>: the football-plyers blocked each other</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Choke</b></font><ul><li><b>chuẩn bị sẵn chèn khi đẩy xe bò lên dốc</b>: to have a choke ready when pushing an ox-cart up the slope</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chèn lấn<html><i>chèn lấn</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> như chèn ép</b></font></li></ul></html>
chèn ép<html><i>chèn ép</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To block, to keep back</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chèo<html><i>chèo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To row</b></font><ul><li><b>chèo thuyền</b>: to row a boat</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Oar</b></font><ul><li><b>mái chèo</b>: an oar</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Traditional operetta</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Chèo (Traditional operetta) is an original synthesis of folk songs, dances and narration. The words of the play are imbued with the lyricism of folk songs, proverbs and popular sayings. A Chèo play could be put on stage in a large theatre, but it also could be performed successfully on one or two bed mats spread in the middle of a communal house with a cast of only three: a hero, a heroine and a clown. The clown in a Chèo play seems to be a supporting role, but actually he or she is very important to the performance. The clowns present a comic portrayal of social life, with ridiculous and satirical words and gestures they reduce the audience to tears of laughter. The national Chèo repertoire includes among others Truong Vien, Kim Nhan, Lưu Bình Dương Lễ and Quan Am Thị Kính, which are considered treasures of the traditional stage</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chèo bẻo<html><i>chèo bẻo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Drongo</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chèo chống<html><i>chèo chống</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To row and punt</b></font><ul><li><b>chèo chống mãi mới đưa được thuyền vào bờ</b>: by dint of rowing and punting, he succeeded in bringing the boat to shore</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To buffet with difficulties</b></font><ul><li><b>một mình chèo chống nuôi cả đàn em</b>: by buffeting with difficulties alone, she managed to bring up her band of sisters and brothers</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chèo kéo<html><i>chèo kéo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To invite with insistence</b></font><ul><li><b>To solicit (nói về gái ddiếm)</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chèo queo<html><i>chèo queo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Curled up, coiled up</b></font><ul><li><b>nằm chèo queo vì lạnh</b>: to lie curled up because of the cold</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
ché<html><i>ché</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> như choé</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chém<html><i>chém</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To cut (with a sword..), to guillotine</b></font><ul><li><b>chém đầu</b>: to cut off (someone's) head</li><li><b>xử chém</b>: to execute by the guillotine</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To sting, to stick it on</b></font><ul><li><b>chỉ đáng một đồng mà bị chém ba đồng</b>: to be stung for three dong for something worth one dong</li><li><b>quán này chém tợn</b>: this inn sticks it on</li><li><b>chém to kho mặn</b>: to attach more importance to substance than to form</li><li><b>chém tre không dè đầu mặt</b>: to do something with little regard for the feeling of the people concerned</li></ul></li></ul><i></i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> chêm</b></font><ul></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To wedge</b></font><ul><li><b>chêm cán cuốc</b>: to wedge a hoe handle</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To cut in</b></font><ul><li><b>ngồi nghe thỉnh thoảng chêm vào một câu</b>: to listen and cut in from time to time with a sentence</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Wedge</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chéo<html><i>chéo</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Diagonal, bias, slanting, oblique</b></font><ul><li><b>cắt chéo mảnh vải</b>: to cut a piece of cloth on the bias</li><li><b>nhảy chéo sang một bên</b>: to jump obliquely sideways</li><li><b>đập chéo bóng</b>: to drive the ball obliquely</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Crossed, crosswise, crisscross</b></font><ul><li><b>đường ngang ngõ tắt chéo nhau như mắc cửi</b>: sideways and lanes crisscross like a weaving pattern</li><li><b>đan chéo</b>: To knit crosswise, to plait crosswise</li><li><b>bắn chéo cánh sẻ</b>: to fire crosswise, to lay a cross fire</li></li></ul></ul></li></ul><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Diagonal cloth</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chê<html><i>chê</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To make little of, to run down</b></font><ul><li><b>Nói chín thì làm nên mười Nói mười làm chín, kẻ cười người chê</b>: For nine things promised, one should do ten; If for ten things promised, one does only nine, one will be made little of and sneered at</li><li><b>lợn chê cám</b>: the pig cared little for bran soup (because of some illness)</li><li><b>chê ỏng chê eo</b>: to be overparticular about details of a thing to choose; to pick and choose</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b><i>vụng múa chê đất lệch</i></b></font><ul><li><b> xem vụng</b></li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chênh vênh<html><i>chênh vênh</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> adj</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Tottery, tottering</b></font><ul><li><b>chiếc cầu tre bắc chênh vênh qua suối</b>: a tottery bamboo bridge spanned across the stream</li><li><b>nhà sàn chênh vênh bên sườn núi</b>: a tottery hut on stilts on the mountain slope</li><li><b>thế chênh vênh như trứng để đầu đẳng</b>: a tottery position like hanging by a thread</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chí thiết<html><i>chí thiết</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Very intimate, very close</b></font><ul><li><b>tình anh em chí thiết</b>: very intimate fraternity</li><li><b>đồng minh chí thiết</b>: a very close ally</li></ul></li></ul></html>

chí tuyến<html><i>chí tuyến</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Tropic</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chí tình<html><i>chí tình</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Wholehearted</b></font><ul><li><b>người bạn chí tình</b>: a wholehearted friend</li><li><b>ăn ở chí tình với mọi người</b>: to show a whole heart in one's dealing with everyone</li></ul></li></ul></html>
chí tôn<html><i>chí tôn</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Most venerated</b></font><ul><li><b>Đấng chí tôn</b>: The Most Venerated, God</li></ul></li></ul></html>
chí tử<html><i>chí tử</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Deadly, to death</b></font><ul><li><b>giáng cho những đòn chí tử</b>: to strike deadly blows</li><li><b>mấy con thú tranh mồi, cắn xé nhau chí tử</b>: some beasts were disputing a prey, inflicting deadly wounds on one another</li><li><b>làm việc chí tử</b>: to work oneself to death</li><li><b>nghèo chí tử</b>: deadly poor</li></ul></li></ul></html>

chí ít<html><i>chí ít</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> At least, at the very least</b></font></li></ul></html>
chích<html><i>chích</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To lance, to tap</b></font><ul><li><b>chích nhọt</b>: to lance a boil</li><li><b>chích mủ cao su</b>: to tap (latex from) rubber-trees</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To sting</b></font><ul><li><b>bị muỗi chích</b>: to be stung by mosquitoes</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To inject</b></font><ul><li><b>chích thuốc</b>: to inject medicine</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chích ngừa<html><i>chích ngừa</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>to inoculate; to get immunisation shot</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>

chôm chôm<html><i>chôm chôm</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> noun</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> Rambutan</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>A rambutan tree has a broad foliage and many branches. The tree yields fruit at the beginning of the rainy season in the southern provinces. The</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>Chom fruit season finishes at the end of the rainy season (from May to</b></font></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>October). The skin of the fruit is tough, thick and hairy. Its pulp is transparent white and tender, and has a cool sweet taste in the mouth.The kind of rambutan most reputed nation-wide is grown in Binh Hoa Phuoc village in Long Ho district (Vinh Long province). During the rambutan season, one can notice the typical bright red colour of rambutan fruit stands located in the markets or along road intersections throughout the southern provinces</b></font></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chôn<html><i>chôn</i><br/><ul><li><b><i> verb</i></b><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To bury, to fix in the ground</b></font><ul><li><b>chôn cột</b>: to fix a stake in the ground</li><li><b>chôn của</b>: to bury valuables</li><li><b>người chết chưa chôn</b>: a dead person waiting to be buried</li><li><b>nơi chôn nhau cắt rốn</b>: native place, birthplace</li></ul></li></ul></li></ul></html>
chôn chân<html><i>chôn chân</i><br/><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b> To confine oneself, to keep oneself shut up</b></font><ul><li><b>hắn chôn chân ở làng, không rời nhà một bước</b>: he confined himself to his village and never went out of his house</li></ul></li></ul><ul><li><font color='#cc0000'><b>To pin down</b></font></li></ul></html>
